publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: An exposicion of the kinges prerogatiue : collected out of the great abridgement of Iustice Fitzherbert and other olde writers of the lawes of Englande by the right woorshipfull sir William Staunford Knight, lately one of the iustices of the Queenes maiesties court of como pleas: whereunto is annexed the proces to the same prerogatiue appertaining. 1567
monogr.author: Staunford, William, Sir

div.p: Diuers other prerogatiues therbe, which ye kīg hath by the order of ye comō law yt be not wtī this statute cōprīsed, a great part wherof vnder ye title of Prerogatife master Fitz herbart hath most diligētli noted in his great Abridgmēt, & so well ordred & placed there, yt I doo of purpose omit to reherse them here. The rest woulde require so longe a serche that oneles I had gathered and noted them al redie (as I haue not dōe in dede) I should be faine to peruse the hole bodie of ye comō Lawes for the knowleg therof wheruntoo time seruethe mee not, wherefore at this time myne intent is not to medle with them.
